intro: Stylidium inundatum, commonly known as the water lily stylidium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its unique, spurred petals that resemble those of a water lily. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and swampy areas, where it thrives in waterlogged soils. Its leaves are broad and floating, while its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish in color. Stylidium inundatum is adapted to aquatic conditions, with specialized structures that aid in pollination and water retention.
